applications.name: Google Chrome
applications.description: Google Chrome is a fast, secure web browser with extensive extension support, built-in developer tools, and seamless integration with Google services. Chrome includes accessibility features like screen reader support, zoom controls, and keyboard navigation.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and T together to open a new blank tab and place focus in the address bar for typing a URL or search.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new tab opened and focus in address bar. Tab appears at the end of current tab strip.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and N together to open a new Chrome browser window with a blank tab.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new window opened. Useful for organizing different browsing sessions.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and N together to open a new incognito window for private browsing without saving history.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce incognito window opened. Browsing history, cookies, and site data not saved after closing.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and W together to close the currently active tab and move focus to the adjacent tab.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce tab closed and read title of newly active tab. Can reopen with Ctrl+Shift+T.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and W together to close the entire browser window and all its tabs.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce window closing. All tabs in window will close. Recent tabs can be reopened from history.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and T together to reopen the most recently closed tab in the order they were closed.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce tab reopened and read page title. Press repeatedly to reopen multiple closed tabs in reverse order.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Tab together to switch to the next tab to the right in the tab strip.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new active tab title and URL. Cycles to first tab when reaching the end.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Tab together to switch to the previous tab to the left in the tab strip.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new active tab title. Cycles to last tab when reaching the beginning.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and a number from 1 to 8 to jump directly to that tab position. For example, Ctrl+1 goes to first tab.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce the selected tab title and URL. Efficient way to navigate to specific tabs without cycling.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and 9 together to jump directly to the last tab regardless of how many tabs are open.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce last tab title and URL. Always jumps to rightmost tab.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Page Up together to move the current tab one position to the left in the tab strip.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce tab repositioned. Visual only, tab content unchanged.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Page Down together to move the current tab one position to the right in the tab strip.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce tab repositioned. Useful for organizing tabs.

variants.keys: Shift + F10 on tab, select Pin tab

shortcuts.description: Open tab context menu and select Pin tab to make the tab smaller and fix it to the left side of tab strip.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce tab pinned or unpinned. Pinned tabs stay open and cannot be accidentally closed.

variants.keys: Shift + F10 on tab, select Duplicate

shortcuts.description: Open tab context menu and select Duplicate to create an exact copy of the current tab including its history.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new tab created. Duplicated tab appears immediately after original.

variants.keys: Shift + F10 on tab, select Mute site

shortcuts.description: Open tab context menu and select Mute site to silence audio from that tab without closing it.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce site muted or unmuted. Prevents audio from interfering with screen reader.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Left Arrow together to navigate back to the previous page in the current tab's history.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous page loading and read page title when loaded. Standard browser back button.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Right Arrow together to navigate forward to the next page in the current tab's history.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce next page loading. Only works if you've previously gone back.

shortcuts.description: Press F5 to reload the current page and refresh its content from the server.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce page reloading. Useful to see updated content or fix loading errors.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F5 together to reload the page while bypassing cached content, forcing fresh download of all resources.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce page reloading. Clears cached files to show latest version. Slower than normal reload.

shortcuts.description: Press Escape to stop the current page from loading further, displaying whatever content has loaded so far.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce page loading stopped. Useful for slow-loading pages or to stop unwanted redirects.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and Home together to navigate to your configured homepage in the current tab.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce homepage loading. Homepage can be set in Chrome settings.

shortcuts.description: Press Space bar to scroll down one screen height on the current web page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce new visible content. Standard way to read long pages incrementally.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Space together to scroll up one screen height on the current web page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce content as viewport changes. Useful for reviewing content.

shortcuts.description: Press Home to scroll instantly to the top of the current web page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce top of page. Focus may remain at previous position for screen reader navigation.

shortcuts.description: Press End to scroll instantly to the bottom of the current web page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bottom of page. Useful for quickly reaching page footer or end of article.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and L together to place focus in the address bar and select the current URL for easy replacement.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce address bar focused and read current URL. Type new URL or search term and press Enter.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and D together to place focus in the address bar, alternative to Ctrl+L.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce address bar focused. Same function as Ctrl+L.

shortcuts.description: Type a search term in the address bar and press Enter to search with your default search engine.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce search suggestions as you type. Address bar functions as both URL bar and search box.

shortcuts.context: When address bar has focus with URL typed
shortcuts.description: Type a URL or search term, then press Alt and Enter to open it in a new background tab while staying on current tab.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new tab opened in background. Current tab remains active for continued browsing.

shortcuts.context: When address bar dropdown shows suggestions
shortcuts.description: Press Up or Down Arrow keys to navigate through address bar suggestions including history, bookmarks, and search suggestions.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce each suggestion as you navigate. Press Enter to open selected suggestion.

shortcuts.description: Navigate to an address bar suggestion and press Shift and Delete to remove it from history.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce suggestion deleted. Removes unwanted items from autocomplete history.

shortcuts.description: Type a website name without www. or .com, then press Control and Enter to automatically add them and navigate.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce full URL loading. Typing google becomes www.google.com automatically.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and P together to open the print dialog for printing or saving the current page as PDF.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce print preview dialog. Navigate options with Tab and arrow keys.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and S together to save the current web page to your computer as HTML or complete web page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce save dialog. Choose location and format for saved page.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and F together to open the find bar for searching text on the current page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce find bar opened and place focus in search field. Type term and press Enter to find matches.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and G together to jump to the next occurrence of the search term on the page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce match number and may read surrounding context. Cycles through all matches.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and G together to jump to the previous occurrence of the search term.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous match. Navigates backward through search results.

shortcuts.description: Press Escape to close the find bar and return focus to the page content.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce find bar closed. Page highlights from search are removed.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and U together to open a new tab showing the HTML source code of the current page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce source view opened. Useful for developers and technical users to inspect page markup.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Plus Sign together to increase the zoom level of the current page making text and images larger.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce zoom percentage. Helpful for users with low vision. Page content reflowns to fit.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Minus Sign together to decrease the zoom level of the current page making content smaller.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce zoom percentage. Useful to fit more content on screen.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Zero together to reset the zoom level to default one hundred percent magnification.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce zoom reset to default. Returns page to original size.

shortcuts.description: Press F11 to enter fullscreen mode hiding browser toolbars and showing only page content. Press F11 again to exit.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce fullscreen mode. Maximizes viewing area. Press F11 or Esc to exit fullscreen.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and D together to bookmark the current page, opening a dialog to edit name and choose folder.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bookmark dialog opened. Edit name and select folder, then press Enter to save.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and D together to save all currently open tabs as bookmarks in a new folder.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bookmark folder dialog. Choose folder name to organize related tabs together.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and B together to toggle visibility of the bookmarks bar below the address bar.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce bookmarks bar shown or hidden. Bar provides quick access to favorite sites.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and O together to open the Bookmarks Manager for organizing, searching, and editing bookmarks.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Bookmarks Manager opened. Search, organize into folders, and delete bookmarks.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and H together to open the History panel showing recently visited pages organized by date.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce History panel opened. Navigate history with arrow keys. Search or clear browsing history.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and J together to open the Downloads page showing recent downloads and their status.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Downloads page opened. View, pause, resume, or open downloaded files.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Delete together to open Clear browsing data dialog for removing history, cookies, and cache.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Clear browsing data dialog. Select time range and data types to clear.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and F together to open the Chrome menu with options for settings, extensions, history, and more.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce menu opened. Navigate with arrow keys and press Enter to select items.

shortcuts.description: Open Chrome menu and press S, or use direct shortcut, to open Settings page for configuring Chrome preferences.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Settings page opened. Configure appearance, search engine, privacy, and accessibility options.

shortcuts.description: Type chrome colon slash slash extensions in the address bar to open the Extensions management page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Extensions page. Enable, disable, remove, or configure extension settings.

shortcuts.description: Press F12 to open Chrome Developer Tools for inspecting HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and debugging web pages.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Developer Tools opened. Advanced tool for web developers. Complex interface with multiple panels.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and I together to open Developer Tools, alternative to F12.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Developer Tools panel. Same function as F12 key.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and J together to open Developer Tools with Console tab active for viewing JavaScript errors and logs.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Console tab opened. Shows JavaScript errors, warnings, and console output.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and C together to activate element inspector mode for selecting page elements to inspect.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce inspect mode active. Click on page elements to view their HTML and CSS in Developer Tools.

shortcuts.description: Press Tab to move focus forward through interactive elements like links, buttons, and form fields on the page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce each element type and label as focus moves. Standard keyboard navigation for accessibility.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Tab together to move focus backward through interactive elements on the page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce previous element as focus moves backward. Essential for accessible navigation.

shortcuts.context: When link or button has focus
shortcuts.description: Press Enter to activate the currently focused link, button, or other interactive element.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce action such as link activating or button pressed. Standard activation method.

variants.keys: Ctrl + Click or Ctrl + Enter on focused link

shortcuts.context: When link has focus or on click
shortcuts.description: Hold Control and click a link, or press Control and Enter on a focused link, to open it in a new background tab.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new tab opened. Original tab remains active for continued browsing.

variants.keys: Shift + Click or Shift + Enter on focused link

shortcuts.context: When link has focus or on click
shortcuts.description: Hold Shift and click a link, or press Shift and Enter on a focused link, to open it in a new window.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce new window opened. Link opens in separate browser window.

shortcuts.description: Press F7 to toggle caret browsing mode which displays a movable cursor for selecting text with keyboard on web pages.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce caret browsing enabled. Allows text selection using arrow keys without mouse. Press F7 again to disable.

shortcuts.description: Press Arrow keys to move the text cursor character by character or line by line through page content.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers read text as caret moves. Hold Shift while moving to select text for copying.

variants.keys: NVDA: Insert + Down Arrow, JAWS: Insert + Down Arrow

shortcuts.description: Use screen reader commands to begin continuous reading of page content from current position to end.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers read all page text continuously. Press Control to stop reading. Commands vary by screen reader.

shortcuts.context: In text field or on page
shortcuts.description: Press Control and A together to select all text in the current text field or all content on the page.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce all content selected or selection range. Use in text fields or with caret browsing enabled.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and C together to copy selected text to the clipboard for pasting elsewhere.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce text copied to clipboard. Standard copy function across all applications.

shortcuts.context: When text is selected in editable field
shortcuts.description: Press Control and X together to cut selected text from an editable field and place it on the clipboard.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce text cut. Removes text from field while copying to clipboard for pasting.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and V together to paste clipboard content at the cursor position in an editable field.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce text pasted. Inserts previously copied or cut text.

shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and V together to paste clipboard content without formatting as plain text only.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce text pasted. Removes formatting like fonts, colors, and styles from pasted content.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Z together to undo the last text editing action in an editable field.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce undo action. Reverts most recent change to text.

shortcuts.context: In editable text field after undo
shortcuts.description: Press Control, Shift, and Z together to redo a previously undone action in an editable field.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers may announce redo action. Restores change that was undone.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Backspace together to delete the entire word before the cursor position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce word deleted. Faster than deleting character by character.

shortcuts.description: Press Control and Delete together to delete the entire word after the cursor position.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce word deleted. Efficient editing for removing complete words.

shortcuts.action: Move cursor to start of line
shortcuts.description: Press Home to move the cursor to the beginning of the current line in a text field.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cursor at start of line. Quick navigation to line beginning.

shortcuts.action: Move cursor to end of line
shortcuts.description: Press End to move the cursor to the end of the current line in a text field.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cursor at end of line. Efficient for appending to existing text.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift and Escape together to open Chrome's built-in Task Manager showing resource usage for tabs and extensions.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce Task Manager opened. View and end processes consuming excessive resources.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and N together to move focus to a Chrome notification for interacting with notification buttons.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce notification and read its content. Navigate buttons with Tab and activate with Enter.

shortcuts.description: Press Alt and E together to open the Chrome menu, alternative to Alt+F.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce menu opened. Access Chrome settings, tools, and options.

shortcuts.description: Press Shift, Alt, and T together to move focus to the Chrome toolbar for keyboard navigation of toolbar buttons.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce toolbar focused. Navigate buttons with arrow keys and activate with Enter.

shortcuts.context: When extension popup or dialog is open
shortcuts.description: Press Alt, Shift, and A together to move focus to an inactive popup window or extension interface.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce popup focused. Useful for accessing extension interfaces with keyboard.

shortcuts.description: Open Chrome Settings, navigate to Reset and clean up section to access Chrome Cleanup Tool for removing harmful software.
shortcuts.notes: Screen readers announce cleanup options. Windows-specific feature for malware removal.
